Data: Udana to Warner, no run 129kph, good length wide of off, he's back and punching this to backward point
Udana to Warner, no run good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
Udana to Warner, no run 128kph, full outside off, he pushes on the front foot, opening the face to point
Udana to Warner, 2 runs angled into leg, he clips this through midwicket for a couple
Udana to Warner, 1 run 129kph, short and wide, he's back and cutting with control to deep point
Udana to Finch, 1 run 128kph, good length, angled wide of off, he sits back and cuts with a bottom hand jab to deep point
Perera to Finch, 2 leg byes 125kph, shorter on the hip, it comes off the thigh guard and rolls away to square leg but the man is back, Finch sprints back to pinch two

Perera to Finch, no run huge appeal for LBW given not out. Sri Lanka take their time but they eventually review. Good length, nipping back from outside off, he thrust bat and pad at the ball together. Was it pad first? It was. Just. Now is outside the line? The impact is umpire's call on the line. It was hitting the stumps. Not out remains. Sri Lanka keep their review
Perera to Finch, 1 run 133kph, good length outside off, he pushes slowly towards cover and they run a tight one. Good early call from Finch and response from Warner
Perera to Warner, no run 133kph, good length, angled across, he defends on the front foot to point
Perera to Warner, 1 wide short and wide, 130kph, way too wide of off and called
Perera to Warner, 1 run 129kph, back of a length, he punches off the back foot to deep cover point
Perera to Finch, 1 run good length, 130kph, he pushes forward and gets a thick outside that runs to third man
Udana to Finch, 1 run short and wide, he sits back and thumps a cut shot to deep point
Udana to Warner, 1 run good length, angled into off, he's back and nudging this wide of mid on
Udana to Finch, no run fuller outside off, he punches on the up to cover
Udana to Finch, 2 runs 128kph, short outside off, he sits back and pulls behind square into the gap between deep square and fine leg for two
Udana to Finch, no run 130kph, good length, angled across and he defends on the front foot
Udana to Finch, 2 runs 135kph, shorter outside off, he's punching firmly off the back foot straight of deep cover-point for a couple
Perera to Warner, 1 run 128kph, shorter outside off, he mistimes a cut but finds the gap getting it out to deep cover-point
Perera to Finch, no run 133kph, full on middle and off, he drives to mid on
Perera to Finch, 1 run 131kph, full and a hint of shape in, he drives but gets it off the inside half of the bat through square leg to the sweeper
Perera to Warner, 1 run 130kph, good length, outside off, he's half forward pushing at it, getting a thick edge that runs past backward point, another misfield allows one
Perera to Finch, 1 run he walks at Thisara, who bangs in, he's standing up and working this off the hip through square leg
Perera to Warner, no run good length, on off, he's forward and defending back to the bowler
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run full on off, driven back to the bowler
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run tossed up, he drives handsomely to long on for one
Dhananjaya to Warner, 1 run he skips down to a full ball drifting in and clips it to deep long on
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run flatter on leg, he sits back and works this through square leg
Dhananjaya to Warner, no run drifting in and sliding on, he mistimes a drives off the thick inside half of the bat to midwicket
Dhananjaya to Warner, no run tossed up, he pushes uppishly but safely to cover
Perera to Finch, no run good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
Perera to Finch, 1 run 131kph, good length wide of off, he drives fluently on the rise to deep cover-point
Perera to Warner, 1 run 125kph, back of a length outside off, he is back and defending with soft hands to cover-point and pinching one
Perera to Finch, no run 127kph, good length on off, he defends from the crease
Perera to Finch, no run 131kph, good length on off, he is on the walk defending with the full face
Perera to Finch, 1 run 129kph, wide of off, he climbs into it, thumping a drive on the up to the sweeper in the deep at cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run flatter and shorter on off, he's back and working this to midwicket
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run tossed up on off, he drives firmly to long on
Dhananjaya to Warner, no run drifting into off, he defends on the front foot

Dhananjaya to Warner, OUT bowled him! Well bowled from Dhananjaya. Warner got in a tangle. It was a good length, drifting in and skidding on, Warner pressed forward initially, then pressed back to give room to cut but it was too full and it crashed into middle
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, no run drifts in a full delivery, defended
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, no run shortens his length, he goes back into the crease and blocks
Perera to Finch, 1 run steered behind point, down to square third man. Impressive half-century for Finch. Has a job to do though
Perera to Khawaja, no run slants a length delivery across, defended towards point
Perera to Khawaja, no run nice, tight line. Length on the stumps, hint of angle away, defended back
Perera to Khawaja, 1 run steered wide of point
Perera to Finch, no run touch fuller, around off, Finch is well forward as he stabs it away
Perera to Finch, 1 run cramped for room as he punches this wide of cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run drifts away from the batsman, driven straight to cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run punched to mid-on for an easy single
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, 1 run slider back in from around the stumps, eased wide of cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run too short, he rocks back and slaps this to deep cover
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, no run pushed through quicker on the stumps, kept out
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, 1 run punched to deep cover again
Pradeep to Khawaja, no run beauty! Slants one across the batsman, beaten on the drive
Pradeep to Khawaja, FOUR runs thick outside edge, races past the vacant third slip to the third man boundary. Lucky runs
Pradeep to Khawaja, no run dug in short on leg stump, Khawaja ducks under it and looks away as this zips over his helmet
Pradeep to Khawaja, 1 run angles this down to square third man
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run punched on the up to deep cover

Pradeep to Khawaja, no run skiddy bouncer, excellent bouncer. Seemed a lot faster than the 134kph on the speed gun. Khawaja was looking to sway out of the way but realised it was too quick and suddenly had to look away as he ducked.
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run fuller and faster on the stumps, defended
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run not much turn, just skids through on a length, punched back
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run extra bounce off a length, turns this to short midwicket
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run works this wide of midwicket as they jog the single
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, 1 run driven into the gap at extra cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run right back into the crease as he punches this to midwicket

Pradeep to Khawaja, no run huge appeal for lbw, will Sri Lanka review? No, they don't. Pradeep slants this across, Khawaja is looking to run it down to third man but is beaten. Played it with an angled bat. Appeared to be some sound as it passed through on real time, but nothing on snicko.
Pradeep to Khawaja, 1 run half-pulls this down to fine leg, this one rushed through
Pradeep to Finch, no run Beaten! Was looking to play a short-arm jab but this one nipped back in to cut into two halves. Excellent from Pradeep
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run attacks the stumps, Finch feels for this and squirts this off a thick inside edge to fine leg
Pradeep to Khawaja, no run excellent short ball, once again rushes through as Khawaja looks away and ducks simultaneously.
Pradeep to Khawaja, no run punches this full-length delivery to extra cover
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run turns this flatter delivery on off-stump to midwicket
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run good grab down leg. Short and sliding down, Finch was looking for a powerful sweep to beat short fine.
Dhananjaya to Finch, 2 runs makes room and punches this past cover, down to the boundary rider but the running is top notch. Udana caught napping in the deep.
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run drills this down to long-off to raise Australia's 100
Dhananjaya to Khawaja, no run eases this to point from the crease

Dhananjaya to Khawaja, OUT first Warner, now Khawaja and Sri Lanka back in this! This is nicely tossed up, drifting in from around the stumps, Khawaja looks to sweep - takes him on with the short boundary in sight - hits it well but picks out Udana at deep midwicket. Massive blow.
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run slants this in from wide of the crease, tucked down to fine leg
Pradeep to Smith, no run short of length ball that nips back in from outside off, Smith is hit on the thigh pad as he hops across to whip it square
Pradeep to Smith, 1 run whipped to deep square to get off the mark
Pradeep to Finch, no run attacks the stumps, gets this to jag back in off the seam, plays down the wrong line and squirts this off a thick inside edge to short midwicket
Pradeep to Finch, no run beaten on the pull. Had to fetch it from outside off, was too early into this stroke. Good effort ball from Pradeep.

Pradeep to Finch, SIX runs he's picked the bones out of this! Dropped short, looking to bowl a bouncer but this one doesn't bounce as much and Finch hammers this pull behind square. Sails into the stands. Was waiting for it and put it away disdainfully when it did.
Dhananjaya to Smith, no run lunges forward and stabs this to short mid-on
Dhananjaya to Smith, no run drilled back to the bowler
Dhananjaya to Smith, no run punches to short midwicket, diving stop by the skipper
Dhananjaya to Smith, 1 run turns this wide of square leg for a quick single
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run squirts one off a thick inside edge to long-on
Dhananjaya to Smith, no run good stop off his own bowling, this was hit back hard. Dhananjaya threw himself to his right to stop a certain single
Udana to Finch, 1 run slower and fuller on the stumps, eased to long-on
Udana to Smith, 1 run works this from outside off towards deep midwicket
Udana to Finch, 1 run cutter on a length, dabbed wide of the diving point fielder
Udana to Smith, no run goes full and across, Smith exposes middle and leg stump as he walks across to defend back
Udana to Smith, 2 runs whips this into the acres of open space at deep midwicket
Udana to Smith, FOUR runs full toss on middle and Smith wrists this imperiously to pick the gap at deep midwicket. Strong bottom hand and powerful wrists
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 wide through with the pull even before the ball arrived, but this was slipping down leg.
Dhananjaya to Finch, no run punched back to the bowler
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run eased down to long-on
Dhananjaya to Smith, 1 run gets to the pitch and eases this down to long-on as they jog the single
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run slapped to long-off, this was short and he made room to play the stroke
Dhananjaya to Smith, no run gets well forward and defends
Dhananjaya to Smith, 1 run whips this down to deep midwicket
Udana to Smith, 1 run steered down to square third man
Udana to Finch, 1 run once again just a gentle little dab down to third man
Udana to Smith, 1 run walks across and whips this full delivery on off to Malinga at deep square leg
Udana to Finch, 1 run gorgeous straight dive, long-on comes around to cut that off
Udana to Smith, no run driven firmly but straight to mid-off
Udana to Smith, FOUR runs smears this square drive behind point. Too full from Udana, made it easy as Smith shuffles across and then reached out to find the gap.
Dhananjaya to Finch, FOUR runs he's helped this along to beat short fine. Poor, sliding down and all he had to do was get some bat. Easy pickings
Dhananjaya to Finch, SIX runs he's heaved this deep into the stands at long-on! Saw it tossed up, got to the pitch and muscled it away. Races into the 80s with a 92-metre hit.
Dhananjaya to Finch, SIX runs again! Thumped. Absolutely thumped. Too full, right into his swinging arc, Finch ain't gonna miss out. He's warmed up properly. No spin, no drift, angles in and boom!
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 wide slides it down leg as he changes his angle to bowl from around the stumps
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run leading edge, rolls past mid-off for a single. Better from Dhananjaya
Dhananjaya to Smith, 1 run eased down to long-on
Dhananjaya to Finch, 1 run quicker length ball on middle and leg, worked to deep square
Malinga to Finch, 1 run slips this on middle and leg, worked to deep square
Malinga to Smith, 1 run banged in short but this isn't the Lasith of 2007, Smith gets on top of the bounce and nudges it gently into the leg side
Malinga to Finch, no run gentle tap into the off side as Malinga bowls a tight line.
Malinga to Finch, 1 wide slower one down leg, Finch didn't pick it early, thought this was coming right at his body. Then realised it wasn't and tried to get down to lap, but missed
Malinga to Finch, 1 run squeezed into the leg side, past midwicket
Malinga to Smith, 2 runs pulled from outside off towards deep midwicket, Udana comes around to cut that off
Malinga to Smith, 1 run dipping yorker, Smith is a long way across as he tucks this down to fine leg
Siriwardana to Smith, FOUR runs long hop sliding down and Smith helps it along behind square.
Siriwardana to Smith, 2 runs reaches out and smears this drive to sweeper cover, good stop.
Siriwardana to Smith, no run rocks back and cuts to point.
Siriwardana to Smith, 1 run reaches out and drives inside-out to deep cover
Siriwardana to Finch, 1 run looks to hoick, gets a thick inside edge that flies past off stump and whacks the keeper's gloves. Lucky not to drag back
Siriwardana to Smith, 1 run eased with the spin to deep cover
Malinga to Smith, FOUR runs full toss and Smith gleefully takes a step across and punches it to the cover boundary. Easy pickings. Harmless pies from Malinga
Malinga to Smith, 1 wide slower bouncer outside off, way over the batsman's head, wide called and rightly so
Malinga to Smith, no run slower length ball outside off, guided to point
Malinga to Smith, 1 run slower and fuller on the stumps, Smith works this behind square

Malinga to Finch, (no ball) squirts this length delivery to backward point. Oh, dear. There were only four men inside the ring. No-ball and Australia will get a free-hit. Malinga is not amused. Excellent from the umpires.
Malinga to Finch, no run right into the blockhole, dug out, rolls to mid-off. Right on the money this time from Malinga
Malinga to Finch, no run dipping yorker which he turns to midwicket from outside off
Malinga to Finch, 1 run slower and fuller on the stumps, eased to long-on
Siriwardana to Finch, no run sliding into middle and leg, tucks this straight to square leg
Siriwardana to Finch, SIX runs lofted through the line, shoveled to bring up a century! Glorious. This has been a classy innings from the skipper.
Siriwardana to Finch, no run swept powerfully but this is an excellent stop at short fine, picked out the lone man there.
Siriwardana to Finch, 1 run works this down to deep midwicket
Siriwardana to Smith, 1 run squeezes this yorker-length delivery to long-off
Siriwardana to Finch, 1 leg bye sliding down, Finch gets some pad on this as it rolls to short fine leg, quick single. In fact leg byes called
Perera to Finch, no run punches this short of length delivery to cover
Perera to Finch, 1 run forced on the up to deep point
Perera to Smith, no run nice and full outside off, Smith takes a step across and drills this straight to extra cover
Perera to Smith, 2 runs rasping drive into the gap at sweeper cover
Perera to Smith, 1 run length ball on middle and leg, worked wide of midwicket for a quick single
Perera to Finch, 1 run mistimes a cut but has hit it enough to get it to deep point
Udana to Finch, no run slower length ball, mistimed to cover
Udana to Finch, FOUR runs driven imperiously, not even a half-stop by mid-off is enough to prevent it from racing to the long boundary. Superb
Udana to Finch, no run hops back and across as he defends
Udana to Finch, no run lost his shape as he looked to hoick this slower delivery across the line, got a thick inside edge onto the pad
Udana to Finch, no run whips uppishly, lands short of midwicket though
Udana to Finch, 1 run works this gently into the gap between midwicket and square leg
Perera to Finch, 1 run 123kph, good length, he defends with soft hands short of cover to get one
Perera to Smith, no run 129kph, back of a length outside off, he punches off the back foot to backward point
Perera to Smith, FOUR runs edged and it races fine of third man. He was back trying to play an expansive back foot drive and got a genuine edge but there's no slip in place and it flew to the rope
Perera to Smith, 1 run he steps outside off, Thisara goes wider, he punches off the back foot to deep cover-point
Perera to Finch, 1 run 129kph, fuller and wider, he anchors the feet and square drives firmly to deep cover-point
Perera to Smith, 1 run 128kph, he tries a back foot drive, gets a thick inside edge onto pad and it rolls into the off side for a single
Udana to Smith, 1 run short ball, he pulls firmly through square leg to the sweeper
Udana to Finch, no run off spinning slower ball, he defends to point, Smith backs up too far as Finch sends him back, the throw forced Smith to dive but it was wide
Udana to Finch, 1 run 129kph, good length angled across, he sits back and late cuts to backward point on the circle
Udana to Smith, no run 130kph, play and miss trying to run this with the angle to third man. A touch of extra bounce and some nip away
Udana to Smith, 1 run 126kph, back of a length on off, he's back and across in trademark style and working this to square leg
Perera to Smith, no run full on off, he drives firmly to mid on
Perera to Smith, 1 run good length, fifth stump line, he is back and square driving to deep point
Perera to Finch, 1 run good length top of off, he sits back and pushes this to gap at cover-point
Perera to Smith, 1 run 131kph, full outside off, he tries to heave over midwicket but miscues, dragging it through square leg
Perera to Finch, FOUR runs cracking cut shot! Short and wide, he's camped in position early and thumping it past backward point like a missile!
Perera to Finch, 1 run 122kph, good length, outside off, he sits back pushes this with control through point
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run upper cut high and safe landing short of fine third man. It was banged in short and he lifted it with the bounce but only gets one
Pradeep to Smith, no run 138kph, back of a length, he's punching off the back foot but can't beat cover
Pradeep to Smith, 1 run 130kph, back of a length, he's back and across and working this behind square to bring up a half-century for Smith. There are some boos but plenty of applause
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run clears the front leg and scythes this away over cover, Udana runs around the rope and saves three! That was good stop
Pradeep to Smith, 1 run shorter length, on off, he is back and working this behind square

Pradeep to Finch, 2 runs mistimed pull shot just clears midwicket! It was banged in, he tried to pull but it hurried him, he mistimed it but it just ballooned over midwicket's head as he was tight in on the one
Perera to Smith, 1 run 128kph, good length outside off, he works this skilfully with his wrists behind square
Perera to Finch, SIX runs launched over deep square! He sat and waited for length and got it, clearing the front leg and mowing it flat over square leg into the stands! That was a crowd killer!

Perera to Finch, FOUR runs cut in the air just past backward point! It was short and wide and created some more room staying leg side to cut it hard, it was in the air but the diving Dhananjaya couldn't reach it
Perera to Finch, 1 run 128kph, yorker on off, he jams down, bunting out into the off side
Perera to Smith, 1 run 127kph, good length outside off, he square drives to deep cover point
Perera to Finch, no run he sits back to a fuller ball, punches off the back foot to cover but can't beat the man
Pradeep to Smith, FOUR runs whipped behind square and he finds the gap! Attempted yorker, it was very full, he sat deep in the crease and whipped it off his toes and the timing got it to the rope
Pradeep to Smith, FOUR runs brilliant late cut running it fine of third man! He was surprised by the extra bounce but leaned back and guided it fine. Excellent skill
Pradeep to Smith, 1 run full, tailing down leg, he glances this fine to long leg
Pradeep to Finch, FOUR runs backs away and thumps this over cover! He gave room early, freed the arms and thrashed it flat over cover!
Pradeep to Finch, FOUR runs pulled wide of fine leg! A gift of a short ball, rib high, down leg, he just pulled it behind square into the gap!
Pradeep to Finch, 1 run nearly a run out! He got a low full toss, clipped it straight to midwicket and called yes, Dimuth gathered, had a stump and a half to hit and missed! He would have been out
Malinga to Finch, FOUR runs length on leg, he whips this over square leg, one bounce four! 150 for the skipper! He celebrates
Malinga to Finch, 1 run 129kph, full on middle, he swings hard dragging it with the bottom hand along ground through midwicket to the sweeper
Malinga to Smith, 1 wide Smith walked at Malinga who fires a slower ball miles down leg
Malinga to Smith, 1 run he walks down and squares up, gets a length ball wide of off, he punches to cover and takes one
Malinga to Finch, 1 run 130kph, full outside off, he clears the left leg and slices this down to long off along the ground
Malinga to Smith, no run slower ball wide of off, he glides this behind point but picks out the man on the circle

Malinga to Smith, SIX runs Boom over midwicket! This was in the slot, almost on a tee, he swung across the line and middled it, and the sound was so loud from the middle of the bat. Like a gun shot. It went 20 rows back
Udana to Maxwell, 1 wide back of a hand slower ball dragged down leg
Udana to Maxwell, 1 run length slower ball, he's back and just bunting this into the leg side. He was surprised by the bounce
Udana to Marsh, 1 run full and wide sliced behind point
Udana to Maxwell, no run 102kph, yorker, nearly bowls him! What a delivery! Completely deceived him but just missed leg
Udana to Maxwell, 1 run full 135kph yorker, he digs this out, driving it to long off
Udana to Marsh, no run wide yorker, 124kph, almost a full toss, Marsh swings hard but misses

Udana to Marsh, OUT caught at deep midwicket! Well bowled! Back of the hand slower ball, outside off, he tries to heave this to the long boundary at deep midwicket, doesn't get it and Siriwardana takes the catch easily 10m inside the rope
Malinga to Maxwell, 1 run he walks at the bowler, gets half volley and pings it along the ground to deep midwicket
Malinga to Carey, no run 117kph slower ball, on leg, he checks his shot pushing this to cover

Malinga to Carey, 3 runs 113kph, slower ball, he waits and lofts this neatly over, cover, the two men in the deep try and work together, but Udana flicked it over Siriwardana's head and it allowed three
Malinga to Maxwell, 1 run very full outside off, he miscues, dragging it off the toe of the bat towards long on
Malinga to Carey, 1 run nearly a direct hit! Full toss, he drives straight to cover, the man on the circle, Kusal Mendis has time to steady and fire but he misses. Carey was well out
Malinga to Maxwell, 1 run quality yorker on off, he can only dig it out into the off side
Udana to Finch, 1 run full outside off, he backs away and scythes this to cover
Udana to Smith, 2 runs slower ball, outside off, 101kph, he whips this wide of long on, he pushes for two and a misfield allows it
Udana to Smith, 1 run 133kph, good length outside off, he whips it with the angle through square leg

Udana to Finch, OUT skied to cover! Slower ball does the trick! This was well bowled. A back of the hand slower ball at 97kph, Finch cleared the left leg to launch but the extra bounce and lack of pace saw him sky it straight up to cover and the skipper calmly claimed the catch. The end of a wonderful innings.
Udana to Smith, 1 run 138kph, yorker, well bowled, he dugs this out and they scamper through for a single
Udana to Maxwell, 1 run 121kph, high bouncer, Maxwell wanders around then backs away, paddling a pull shot behind square with control
Malinga to Maxwell, 2 runs 129kph, half volley, he plays a conventional straight drive, straight of long off and they get two
Malinga to Maxwell, 1 run full outside off, he tries to drag this to the on side, miscuing it down the ground to long on

Malinga to Smith, OUT bowled him with a cracking yorker! The clock says 130kph but that looked quicker. Smith tried to whip this behind square but it slid under the bat and hit the outside of off stump. Vintage Lasith!
Malinga to Marsh, 1 run slower ball full toss, 111kph, surprises Marsh, he bunts it to backward point
Malinga to Maxwell, 1 run 131kph, low full toss, he whips this off the toe of the bat to long on
Malinga to Marsh, no run 121kph, slower ball on leg, he works this off his pads to midwicket

Udana to Maxwell, OUT Brilliant run out from Udana! Ridiculously good in fact! The back of the hand slower ball was brilliant in itself, forced Maxwell to check his shot, pushing to long on, Udana dived across full stretch, stopped it one handed. Both batsmen retreated. Udana rolled over and threw the non striker's stumps down with Carey just short as he dove back! Magnificent work

Udana to Maxwell, 3 runs sliced just over Mathews at backward point! Another great slower ball forces a mistake from Maxwell, he was through the shot too soon but he just spooned it over backward point!

Udana to Cummins, OUT another direct hit from Udana! This is superb! He nails the yorker, Cummins digs it out on the on side and takes off, Udana whips across like a leopard, Cummins is sent back by Maxwell, Udana gathers, steadies, fires and hits with Cummins miles out at the striker's end!
Udana to Starc, 1 run wide half volley, he drives firmly to long off
Udana to Maxwell, 2 runs full on leg, he clips this through midwicket and they sprint back for two
Udana to Maxwell, 1 run nearly another direct hit from Udana! Slower ball, Maxwell gets a leading edge back to the bowler, he misfields, they pinch a run as Udana cleans up and the throw is wide
Perera to Maxwell, 1 run full and wide, he reaches out and hammers a square drive to deep cover-point
Perera to Starc, 1 run 126kph, full on leg, he whips this off his toes through midwicket the sweeper in the deep
Perera to Maxwell, 1 run wide yorker, he steps outside off and steers this behind point to the man in the deep at wide third man
Perera to Starc, 2 runs 123kph, full on leg, he clips this wide of long on for a couple
Perera to Starc, 1 run 125kph, low full toss, he drives this firmly to long on

Perera to Maxwell, FOUR runs he whips this from outside off stump through square leg! Not quite a six but a seriously good shot! That was an excellent wide yorker, he stepped outside off and whipped it with the bottom hand just past square leg and the man at deep midwicket can't cut it off!
Shashank will be back soon to take you through the start of the chase.

As we wait for the chase, a good time to fill your ears with the latest edition of our Talking World Cup podcast, where our crew make a good fist of making sense of the rivalry, as complex as it is (also on Apple Podcasts here)
Udana was sensational.
2.09pm Innings Break Australia gets 7 for 334 on the back of a stunning 153 from the skipper Aaron Finch. Steve Smith played beautifully and Glenn Maxwell delivered a gem at the end.
Starc to Dimuth, 1 run edged and it races down to square third man where Kane Richardson mops it up
Starc to Perera, no run length ball veering in from wide of the crease, Kusal is hit high on the pad as he plays outside the line. Beat him on the inside edge. Good bowling
Starc to Perera, FOUR runs uppish but into the gap! Scorching drive between cover and point.
Starc to Perera, 1 leg bye rip roaring yorker, Kusal is thrown off balance as he squeezes this between his legs and past the keeper. Came off the pad. Finch and Australia don't review. Good call.
Starc to Dimuth, 2 runs steered over the diving Maxwell at point, down to square third man. Richardson had to move to his left this time, comfortably back for the second run

Starc to Dimuth, FOUR runs stands tall and spanks this wide of point. Got on top of the bounce, used the width and let his timing do the rest. Superb from the skipper. Sri Lanka couldn't have asked for a better start. Gets their fans going, the flags are out
Cummins to Perera, 1 run helped along to fine leg. Did he get some bat on it? Yes, a very faint one onto the thigh pad. He was hurried for pace first up.
Cummins to Dimuth, no run slants a short of length delivery across, left alone
Cummins to Dimuth, 3 runs full on the pads and Dimuth nearly flicks this into the gap past the diving square leg fielder. The ball slows up near the boundary. Excellent wrist work

Cummins to Perera, FOUR runs he's blasted this pull in front of square, tracer bullet stuff! Picked the length early and flat-batted this disdainfully. This is an excellent start for Sri Lanka, stand-and-deliver stuff
Cummins to Perera, no run much fuller and straighter, squirts this into the off side

Cummins to Perera, FOUR runs pulled! This is even better. Right off the middle. Into the gap between midwicket and square leg. Short square boundary that side and at the moment, there's just one winner in this battle. Magnificent approach to the chase. Can Sri Lanka sustain this?
Starc to Dimuth, no run driven back but Starc stops it with his boot on his followthrough. Was timed beautifully though
Starc to Dimuth, no run hops back into the crease and defends back this length delivery. Speedgun clocks that at 149kph
Starc to Dimuth, 2 runs squared up, gets a thick edge and Richardson comes around at third man to stop
Starc to Dimuth, no run on the floor! Yorker honing into the leg at 150kph, Dimuth falls over as he tries to negotiate that.
Starc to Dimuth, no run ducks under this ripper of a bouncer angling in from wide of the crease
Starc to Dimuth, no run beaten for pace, looks to tuck it square but this brushes his thigh pad on the way through to the keeper.
Cummins to Perera, no run punches this length delivery straight to point
Cummins to Perera, no run hits him low on the bat as he tries to drive, rolls to mid-off. The ball is thudding into the bat than it being the other way. Cummins working up serious pace.
Cummins to Perera, 1 run looks to drive, gets a thick inside edge past midwicket
Cummins to Dimuth, no run mistimes this straight drive back to the bowler. Once again late on the shot, toe-ended it.
Cummins to Dimuth, no run beaten as he looks to slash this with a closed bat face. Lucky to not get an edge.

Cummins to Dimuth, 3 runs gorgeous! How good does he look when he looks to play proper cricketing shots? Not a half-volley by any means but he plans half-forward and laces this into the gap between cover and point. Ball slows down towards the square boundary
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run beaten as he gets this to nip away off the seam from the fourth-stump.
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run punches this length ball to mid-on
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run beaten for pace as this skids back in to hit him high on the pad. Stifled appeal, not out.
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run defends this full delivery back to the bowler
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run beaten as he pokes at this delivery with an angled bat face. The change of angle seems to be working already for Australia.
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run works this incoming length ball to midwicket where there's a misfield, and they get through for a single.
Cummins to Dimuth, no run away-going length ball which he bunts to the off side

Cummins to Dimuth, FOUR runs no timing but gets enough on this pull as it races down the hill to the midwicket boundary. This was short, angling away and Dimuth picked the length early and went through with the pull. Lovely.
Cummins to Dimuth, FOUR runs off a thick inside-edge, Cummins can't believe how that's not cannoned into the stumps! Feeble push at a delivery angling away, no feet. Lucky to survive.
Cummins to Dimuth, no run gets a thick inside edge onto the pad as he looks to turn this to the leg side.
Cummins to Dimuth, no run takes a step across and drives this into the off side
Cummins to Dimuth, 1 run steered wide of point, down to third man
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 2 runs back of length on middle and leg, tucked off his hips to deep square
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run squared up a hint as he bunts this into the covers
Behrendorff to Perera, 1 run mistimes this pull into the gap at midwicket
Behrendorff to Dimuth, FOUR runs one-handed pull, beats short fine leg. Swivelled nicely and helped it along. Using the bowler's pace very nicely.

Behrendorff to Dimuth, FOUR runs not for the first time tonight have we seen a thick inside edge flying past the stumps. Dollops of luck here for the skipper as he is late on the frontfoot drive, races to the fine leg boundary.
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run hops back and tucks this into the gap at square leg

Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run Richardson bowled, Dimuth defends, but one of them attempted this delivery in half-heated fashion. Replays confirm Dimuth wasn't entirely read. Dead ball. So he'll rebowl that? Okay, umpire says it's a legal ball as the batsman ended up facing it
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, FOUR runs on the pads and he's clipped this wide of short fine leg. Easy, very easy. Nothing more than a warm-up delivery. Help-me-on-its-way welcome drink
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 1 run beaten as he looks to slap this away
Kane Richardson to Perera, no run right behind the line as he blocks
Kane Richardson to Perera, 2 runs hammered, absolutely hammered. Some effort that from Pat Cummins to run around from deep square to where a deep midwicket would be. Saved two runs for the side
Kane Richardson to Perera, 1 run hoicked across the line to deep square leg
Behrendorff to Perera, SIX runs shades of Jayasuriya! Width and he clobbers this length ball over the extra cover boundary. Stand and deliver
Behrendorff to Perera, 2 runs clipped into the gap and they take two more

Behrendorff to Perera, 5 runs they chance a single of the type Sehwag did after tucking one to mid-on and taking on Lehmann's throw in that 2003 final. This time, there's an overthrow from Finch and they get five (four overthrows). It's all going Sri Lanka's way so far. Kusal threw himself in desperation to complete the run, but not sure even that dive would've saved him if it was a dire
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run superbly flicked down to deep square leg
Behrendorff to Perera, no run right behind the line of this incoming length ball as he defends
Behrendorff to Perera, FOUR runs slipping down leg and he tickles this past short fine leg. Pacy, angling in and all he had to do was get some bat along the way.
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 1 run on middle and leg, worked behind square on the leg side
Kane Richardson to Perera, 2 runs pulled across the line, not timed all that well but he'll come back for the second

Kane Richardson to Perera, FOUR runs dismissed from his presence! Banged in short, Perera wallops this pull in front of square. Raced away to the fence. Tired delivery from Richardson, not going to help bowling such lengths in the mid-130s. Cracking stroke that has forced a new bat on its way. The Sri Lankan fans in the stands are loving it, absolutely loving it.

Kane Richardson to Perera, no run beaten, extra bounce that time. Looked to run it down. Richardson and Carey think there may be something here, right on the edge and Finch reviews with two seconds on the clock. Let's see if there is a spike there. Replays come back with a straight line, which means there is no spike and Kusal can continue batting. Not out and Australia lose a review.
Kane Richardson to Perera, 1 run slapped to the man at sweeper cover, Khawaja it is
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run gets half-forward and bunts this into the off side
Maxwell to Perera, no run shaped up to slog-sweep but ended up easing this tossed up delivery to cover
Maxwell to Perera, no run squirts this back to the bowler off a thick inside edge.
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run sliding into middle and leg, tucked wide of square leg for an easy single
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 wide slips this down leg, wide called as Dimuth looks to tickle this fine with the angle.
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run gets well forward and stabs this away
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifts in a long way from around the stumps, hit on the pad as he looks to work this wide of midwicket
Maxwell to Dimuth, 2 runs onto the backfoot as he works this from outside off towards the gap at deep square and deep midwicket. Excellent running.
Kane Richardson to Perera, 2 runs slashed away up and over point, this plonks towards the square third man boundary and they get a couple
Kane Richardson to Perera, 1 run hops across and bunts this half-pull to short fine leg
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run sways out of the way of this short ball, excellent delivery
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run gets besides the line as he punches this short of length delivery to cover

Kane Richardson to Dimuth, FOUR runs he's clubbed this pull over midwicket, Khawaja may have got an inch on that one but it's not enough. Dimuth has a half-century and his mates are on their feet, as are the fans. What a superb knock so far.
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run hops back and defends this short of length delivery.
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run width and he slaps this to deep point

Maxwell to Dimuth, no run massive appeal for lbw, not given but Australia can't review. Deceived in flight as he looks to skip out, plays all around it and is beaten by the drift. Looked out to me.. Poor decision from Illingworth.
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run gets well forward and bunts it back to the bowler
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run works this with the angle to deep midwicket, the 100's up for Sri Lanka.
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run swept from outside off to short fine leg
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run works this down to deep square leg
Starc to Dimuth, 1 run squeezes this drive into the covers for an easy single
Starc to Perera, no run full on the stumps at 146kph, defended back
Starc to Perera, 1 run works this length ball from middle to deep square leg
Starc to Dimuth, no run goes right back into his crease to defend this short of length delivery.
Starc to Dimuth, 1 run arches back and helps this short delivery along to third man
Starc to Perera, 1 run ripper of a yorker, Kusal squeezes this into the leg side to bring up a 33-ball half-century.
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run punches this down to long-off
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifts in and straightens, Karunaratne defends this back to the bowler
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run turns this to short fine, saw him coming and cleverly shortened his length

Maxwell to Dimuth, 3 runs whips this into the huge gap between mid-on and deep midwicket. Excellent fielding, excellent running. Shaun Marsh covered good ground and then was off balance and going over the ropes -airborne - as he flicked it back
Maxwell to Perera, 1 run leg-side line not favouring him, worked to square leg, sensible from Kusal
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run steps out and flicks this full delivery on the pads to deep midwicket
Starc to Dimuth, 2 runs using Starc's pace to steer this over the infield, bounced over the point fielder's head as he hit it hard into the ground
Starc to Dimuth, 1 run imperious flick down to deep square. Balance and timing all in sync
Starc to Thirimanne, 1 run gets on top of the bounce and turns this uppishly behind leg gully to get off the mark
Starc to Dimuth, no run controls this gentle nudge to the leg side, kept it down.
Starc to Dimuth, FOUR runs helped along, no slip and it races to the third man boundary. All he had to do was hit it wide of the keeper, which he did.
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run turns this to short fine for a quick single
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run slips this down leg, worked to fine leg
Maxwell to Thirimanne, no run nicely tossed up, he covers the line as he gets forward and defends
Maxwell to Thirimanne, no run pushed straight to Smith at cover
Maxwell to Thirimanne, no run nicely tossed up, got this to dip on Thiri as he lunges forward and defends
Maxwell to Thirimanne, no run quicker ball sliding in, pushed to midwicket. Good, tight over that from Maxwell.
Starc to Dimuth, no run 139kph, good length, angled into off stump, he defends across the line working it to midwicket
Starc to Dimuth, no run good length, fourth stump line, he defends from the crease and Maxwell is in quickly from point

Starc to Dimuth, 1 run nearly a run out! Khawaja misses the underarm! Thirimanne was gone. It was a good length, defending to midwicket, Dimuth called quickly but Thirimanne was slow to go, Khawaja swooped, dived and underarmed but missed
Starc to Thirimanne, no run good length, off stump line, he defends off a thick outside edge to backward point
Starc to Thirimanne, no run 145kph, good length, tailing in a touch to off, he defends solidly on the front foot
Starc to Thirimanne, no run 147kph, half volley, firmly driven on the front foot straight back to Starc who does well in his follow through
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run tossed up, he skips out and mistimes a drive to mid on who is deep
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run shorter and wider, he's back cutting to the sweeper at deep point
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run tossed up, on off, he drives back to the bowler
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run 87kph, tossed up, drifting in, he whips this through forwards square to the man in the deep
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run drifting into leg stump, he clips this with the drift through midwicket
Maxwell to Dimuth, FOUR runs brilliant late cut! This was a poor delivery. He pushed an arm ball through wide of off, he sat back and waited and placed it perfectly between the two men behind point
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, no run good length, angled into off, he defends on the front foot
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, 1 run 131kph, good length, fifth stump line, he opens the face and runs this to third man
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 2 runs he shuffles forward, it's a touch shorter, he clips this off the hip behind square in the gap for a couple
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run short and wide, he late cuts in the air through the vacant gully to third man
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, no run 135kph, full outside off, he strides forward and drives elegantly but straight to cover
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, no run 132kph, good length, off stump line, he defends on the front foot
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run 87kph, drifting down leg, it comes off pad and runs fine
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run tossed up, he skips down and clips this on the move to long on
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run angled into leg stump, he glances this fine to fine leg to rotate the strike
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run a mix up but Khawaja throws to the wrong end! It was a late cut to shot third man but Dimuth didn't run, Khawaja threw to the keeper and Thirimanne got home easily
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run drifting into leg, he tucks this through square leg
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifting into leg stump, he tries to whip but misses and is taken on the front pad
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, 1 run full outside off, he square drives to deep cover-point
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run full angled into off, he works this off the front foot to mid on
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run 133kph, good length on off, he drives on the up dragging this mid on
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run good length outside off, he closes the face trying to work to leg, gets a leading edge that runs to third man
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, no run good length, top of off, he's forced to defend on the front foot
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, no run back of a length, top of off, he defends from the crease into the off side
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run attempted reverse sweep to a ball down leg, he paddles it onto his foot
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run tossed up, he drives towards long off but Maxwell cuts it off
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run looped up outside off, he drives to long off this time
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run he advances and lofts this over midwicket, but doesn't time it, deep midwicket comes in and gathers on the bounce
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run shorter on middle, he stands tall and punches to long on
Maxwell to Thirimanne, 1 run tossed up on off, he leans forward playing around his front pad, working this to forward square for one
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, 2 runs driven on the up past cover, they take on the throw from Richardson in the deep, Dimuth is stretched at the non-striker's a direct hit would have had him!

Behrendorff to Thirimanne, 1 leg bye nearly another run out at the non-striker's end! This ball climbed off a length, it came off the arm of Thirimanne and goes behind point, Dimuth calls him through, Maxwell swoops and fires at the non-striker's and just misses!
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run 130kph, good length on off, he's back and working this through square leg to the sweeper
Behrendorff to Thirimanne, FOUR runs cracking square drive on the up through backward point! Too much width and he stood tall and thrashed it behind point with amazing power.
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run 133kph, short on the hip, he glances this off the back foot to fine leg
Cummins to Mendis, no run good length, fifth stump line, he defends from the crease
Cummins to Mendis, no run 138kph, back of a length, climbing outside off, he's back and knocking this down into the off side
Cummins to Mendis, no run 138kph, full angled into off, he pushes a drive to mid on
Cummins to Mendis, 1 wide bouncer, angled well down the leg side
Cummins to Mendis, no run good length,143kph, fourth stump line, he defends on the front foot
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run 134kph, back of a length, fifth stump line, he sits back and runs this down to third man with an angled bat
Cummins to Dimuth, no run 136kph, high bouncer, he ducks well underneath it
Behrendorff to Mendis, no run 134kph, good length, angled across, he defends on the front foot back to the bowler
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run 131kph, good length, leg stump line, he works this into the gap at midwicket
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run 131kph, good length, wide of off, he sits back and glides this to third man
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run 135kph, head high bouncer, he swivels and pulls beautifully, rolling the wrists but nailing it straight to backward square
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run angled into off, 136kph, he works this to midwicket, Khawaja makes the diving save
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run 136kph, angled in and whipped from off stump straight to the man at midwicket
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run 139kph, good length but angled into leg and he clips this neatly off the hip
Cummins to Dimuth, 1 run shorter and wider, he late cuts to third man with control
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run 145kph, angled down leg and he glances easily to fine leg again
Cummins to Dimuth, no run 139kph, full outside off, he drives but doesn't time it well to mid off
Cummins to Dimuth, 1 run 141kph, shorter length, he upper cuts to third man but it lands well short of the fielder
Cummins to Mendis, no run fuller length, 144kph, wide of off, he mistimes a drive to mid off
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 2 runs he walks down the track and flicks this extravagantly behind square, but he didn't middle it, he gets a couple
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run 133kph, full angled into off, his head falls a touch as he whips to mid on
Behrendorff to Dimuth, no run nearly bowled! This was a good length angled in, he tried to pull the length ball, it shot low under the bat and just past off stump
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run he steps forward, gets a length ball wide of off and runs it to third man
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run good length, on leg, he glances this fine to fine leg
Behrendorff to Dimuth, 1 run 133kph, he drives on the up, gets a thick edge that runs along the ground to third man
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run 134kph, good length, angled in towards off, he defends on the front foot
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 2 runs angled in to off, good length, he works this off the front foot behind square, they run well and pinch two
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run 133kph, bouncer outside off, he pulls but is beaten by the extra bounce
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 1 run 131kph, good length wide of off, he sits back and runs this to third man with a horizontal bat
Kane Richardson to Mendis, 1 run good length, 138kph, outside off, he opens the face of the bat and guides it to third man
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 1 run 129kph, short ball, pulled powerfully, in the air behind square but Marsh gets there on the bounce to cut it off
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifting down leg, he glances this straight to backward square
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run tossed up, he dances down and works this neatly through midwicket
Maxwell to Mendis, no run looped up outside off, he opens the face and runs it to short third man
Maxwell to Mendis, 1 run angled into leg stump, he clips this square of midwicket
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run flatter and quicker, he cuts from close to off stump straight to backward point
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run pushed through on off, he's back and working this through midwicket
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, no run 134kph, good length, angled in, he defends on the front foot
Kane Richardson to Dimuth, 1 run 126kph, good length wide of off, he eases into a drive through extra cover to the sweeper
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run 131kph, full outside off, he tries to drive down the ground but gets it straight back to the bowler
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run good length, 130kph, he defends from the crease with an open blade to gully
Kane Richardson to Mendis, no run 133kph, good length, angled into off, he defends from the crease who is tight in on the one
Kane Richardson to Mendis, 1 run hooked in the air but it falls well short of fine leg. He didn't get any of it. The extra bounce surprised him and he wasn't in control but all is OK.
Maxwell to Mendis, no run looped up on off, he works it with the spin to midwicket
Maxwell to Mendis, 1 run tossed up again, he skips down and drives to long on
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifting into leg, he clips this straight to square leg in the ring
Maxwell to Dimuth, no run drifting into leg again, he glances this straight to short fine
Maxwell to Dimuth, 1 run tossed up, he advances and drives neatly to long on

Maxwell to Mendis, SIX runs launched straight down the ground! There we go! He skipped out, got the length he wanted and lofted through the line straight down the ground and to the sight screen! Super shot

Kane Richardson to Dimuth, OUT caught at backward point! Oh no! Three short of a magical hundred. It was short and wide, there to cut for four, but he just guided it, didn't try and get over the top of it or hit it up and over Maxwell at backward point. He picked him out. Catching practice for Maxwell. What a massive blow that is
Kane Richardson to Angelo Mathews, FOUR runs over-pitched and driven easily straight of mid on! Genuine half-volley first up and Mathews didn't have to be asked twice to put that away
Kane Richardson to Angelo Mathews, no run good length, angled into off, he defends from the crease
Kane Richardson to Angelo Mathews, no run 130kph, bouncer, well directed, he ducks under it well
Kane Richardson to Angelo Mathews, no run back of a length, on off, he defends from the crease
Kane Richardson to Angelo Mathews, no run fuller length, angled into off, he pushes on the front foot to mid on
Maxwell to Mendis, 1 run angled into leg, he works this off the front foot behind square
Maxwell to Angelo Mathews, 1 run shorter length, he's back and whipping this through forward square to the sweeper
Maxwell to Mendis, no run shorter length, he's back and punching this to cover
Maxwell to Mendis, no run shorter down leg, he gets down on one knee and paddles it to short fine
Maxwell to Mendis, no run round arm flatter ball, he stands up and punches it straight to midwicket
Maxwell to Mendis, 1 run round arm again at the heels of Mendis, he clips this behind square
Starc to Mendis, no run good length, top of off, he defends from the crease covering up the stumps

Starc to Mendis, SIX runs thumped back over the bowler's head! Off Starc no less! Mid off and mid on were up, this was up in the slot and he swings through the line and crushes it straight at the sight screen. What a shot.
Starc to Mendis, 1 run full and wide, he square drives to deep cover-point
Starc to Angelo Mathews, no run short lifter outside off, he drops his knees and sways underneath it
Starc to Angelo Mathews, no run 141kph short outside off, he's up on his toes pushing this behind point and Maxwell makes a fabulous diving save. he is a gun in that position
Starc to Angelo Mathews, FOUR runs chest high and pulled behind square! Super shot. Not short enough and he controlled it beautifully into the gap between the two men in the deep
Cummins to Mendis, no run hops back and defends this skiddy short of length delivery.
Cummins to Mendis, 1 run tucks this gently off his hip to square leg
Cummins to Angelo Mathews, no run short of length again, Mathews is caught on the hop but he defends again
Cummins to Siriwardana, 2 runs pulled in front of square, Richardson comes around to cut that off at deep midwicket
Cummins to Siriwardana, 1 run driven on the up to sweeper cover
Starc to Siriwardana, 1 wide slips this length ball down leg, wide called.
Starc to Siriwardana, no run shows the full face of the bat to defend this to mid-on
Starc to Perera, SIX runs swivels back and helps this over fine leg! Short, slanting in, Thisara took him on, was looking away but made clean contact. Is there life in the game yet?
Starc to Perera, 1 run flicks this full delivery to deep square leg
Starc to Mendis, 1 run prods outside the line, squirts one off the inside edge to the keeper.
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run length on middle and leg, tucks this down to fine leg
Behrendorff to Dhananjaya, no run right behind the line of this away-going length ball as he defends.
Behrendorff to Dhananjaya, 2 runs on the pads, flicked into the gap at deep midwicket
Behrendorff to Dhananjaya, no run slants this away-going length across, defended from the crease
Behrendorff to Dhananjaya, 1 run squared up but he gets a thick edge down to square third man
Behrendorff to Mendis, 1 run pulled but no timing, straight to deep square leg.
Starc to Udana, 1 run squeezes the drive to deep cover
Starc to Dhananjaya, 1 run yorker-length, tails away late, squirts this wide of point
Starc to Udana, 1 run squirts a thick outside edge to third man, looking to flick this incoming delivery that was angled to the base of middle from around the stumps.
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run hops back and defends
Starc to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs gorgeous off-drive, Warner at mid-off with a full-length dive but can't stop. Timed superbly.
Kane Richardson to Udana, FOUR runs slashed over point, races to the boundary like a tracer bullet. Too much width
Kane Richardson to Udana, no run bunts this short of length delivery to the off side
Kane Richardson to Udana, no run ducks under this short ball without much of a hassle
Kane Richardson to Udana, no run punched straight to cover
Kane Richardson to Udana, 1 wide zips past the thigh pad but the angle down leg means its a wide
Kane Richardson to Udana, 2 runs superb stop at third man by Behrendorff! Looks to flay this over point but gets a thick outside edge. Dive saves a couple of runs
Starc to Malinga, 1 run backs away and squirts this yorker on middle to deep cover. Gave Starc a candid view of all three stumps there
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run right into the blockhole, tails away late but he manages to get some bat on it
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run length on middle, defended
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run attacks his toe with a 147kph thunderbolt, somehow manages to bring his bat in front to keep it out.
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run full toss, eased to deep cover
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run full toss on off, punches straight to mid-off
Kane Richardson to Malinga, no run short ball on middle, somehow manages to get some body behind the line and block
Kane Richardson to Malinga, no run backs away to carve behind point, Richardson shortened his length and got it to bounce a touch more than Malinga anticipates, beaten
Kane Richardson to Malinga, no run squeezes this full delivery to cover
Kane Richardson to Pradeep, no run jams his bat down to keep this yorker from cannoning into the base of off-stump.
Kane Richardson to Pradeep, no run squeezes this yorker back to the bowler
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run helps this down to fine leg, turns down the single
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run scorching drive but straight to mid-off
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run solid forward defence to a full delivery angling in towards the stumps
Starc to Dhananjaya, no run brings out the short-arm jab, timed superbly but straight to deep midwicket. Refuses the run again
Starc to Dhananjaya, 1 run thick edge, down to third man
Starc to Pradeep, no run makes room and steers this down to third man
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run short of length on middle, he hops back and defends
Cummins to Dhananjaya, 1 wide sways out of the way of this slower bouncer
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run backs away, bowler follows him, cramped for room but keeps it out
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run hops back and defends this incoming length ball
Cummins to Dhananjaya, 1 run pulled all along the ground to deep square leg
Cummins to Pradeep, no run looks to back away and slap over point but is beaten for pace
Cummins to Pradeep, no run has a big swipe at this length ball outside off, beaten again.
Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, no run toe-ends a wild slog to mid-on
Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, 1 wide slower and fuller, backs and leaves. Bizarre?
Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, no run yorker-length outside off, squeezed to mid-off

Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, no run walks across and scoops this on the bounce to Behrendorff at short fine. Hint of confusion there, but the fielder gave a clear indication that he isn't sure. Soft signal is not out. Not out it will stay. Clear bump ball.
Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, FOUR runs reverse-scoop that flies over short fine off the back part of the bat. Just eluded Behrendorff as he was back-pedaling.
Kane Richardson to Dhananjaya, 1 run top-edges a pull, falls in no man's land at midwicket.
Kane Richardson to Pradeep, no run swing and a miss. Backed away and swing it towards Lord's.
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run walks across and looks to pull, beaten.
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run defends with an angled bat to the off side
Cummins to Dhananjaya, no run punches to cover
Cummins to Dhananjaya, 1 run hangs his bat up in the air even as he tries to evade this bouncer, lobs into the square leg region

Karunaratne's 97 was in the end Sri Lanka's only consolation. If you're a Sri Lankan fan, you probably feel crushed right now. You have every right to feel that way. There was a ray of hope that turned into spurts of excitement. And then it all came crashing down.

6.00pm Sri Lanka were cruising. 87 without loss in 10 overs. Australia slipped into their Plan B and brought Maxwell on to try and preserve their trumpcards for later. Sri Lanka fell into the trap of the asking rate once Australia got the first breakthrough. Sri Lanka really needed Mathews and Thisara to bail them out, but once they fell, the chase was as good as over.

Thanks for joining us. Great fun today. The first 15 overs of Sri Lanka's innings was as entertaining as any passage so far this World Cup. Pretty sure there's plenty more coming on Sunday. It's India v Pakistan. Hope you've planned out your day in front of the TV and of course with us here on ESPNcricinfo. Trust me, your second-screen experience will be as good, if not better. Australia won by 87 runs
Player of the match is Aaron Finch, AUS
